title: Rohit Pawar slams NCP as video shows Agriculture Minister playing game on phone in assembly
content: NCP (SP) MLA Rohit Pawar made the remark in a post on X and shared a purported video of NCP leader and state Agriculture Minister Kokate playing a game on his mobile phone in the state legislative assembly.

title: Karnataka government constitutes SIT led by Pronab Mohanty to probe Dharmasthala case
content: The order lists M. N. Anucheth, DIG, Recruitment, Sowmyalatha, DCP (CAR headquarters) and Jitendra Kumar Dayama, SP, Internal Security Division as members

title: Martyrs Day rally: Trinamool Congress gears up to sharpen Bengali pride narrative amid migrant row
content: As a party strategist put it, "From 1993 to 2025, this rally is more than a tribute. It is Mamata Banerjee's declaration of battle against injustice, against humiliation, and for the soul of Bengal. It's a political bugle call

title: Plea in Supreme Court critcises Centre, Delhi Police for non-registration of FIR in Justice Varma incident
content: The inquiry committee had concluded that the police and fire authorities were “slipshod” for not lodging an FIR or preparing a seizure memo recording exactly what they came across at the scene of the fire on March 14-15

title: Bihar Police arrests prime accused, three associates in Patna hospital murder case
content: Those arrested include the prime accused Tauseef alias Badshah, his associate Nishu Khan and two others.

title: India will address concerns of private sector on investments in civil nuclear segment: Minister
content: In the budget Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced the government's intention to amend key legislation, including the Atomic Energy Act and the Civil Liability for Nuclear Damage Act, to facilitate private sector involvement

title: Tipra Motha Party says ECI has invited a delegation on July 23 to discuss concerns about Tripura voter roll
content: “After we raised our concerns about possible enrolment of illegal immigrants in Tripura’s voter roll and demanded a Bihar - like Special Intensive Revision (SIR), the Election Commission of India has called us for a meeting on July 23 to discuss these issues,” TMP chief Pradyot Kishore Manikya Debbarma said

title: Odisha burn victim airlifted to Delhi AIIMS for advanced medical treatment
content: The 15-year-old girl, with 70% burns, is stable and she is currently on oxygen support in the ICU and is responding, said Sanjay Giri, Head of Department of Burn Centre, AIIMS Bhubaneswar.

title: Parliament Monsoon Session: Pahalgam, Bihar SIR among key issues raised during all-party meeting
content: Congress’s Gogoi says PM Modi should speak on Pahalgam attack, Bihar SIR; AAP’s Sanjay Singh seeks Centre’s clarifications on Trump’s claim about brokering a ceasefire

title: Heroin worth ₹6 crore seized, 2 arrested in Assam; CM Sarma appreciates police
content: Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma appreciated the Assam police for the arrest of two people who were carrying heroin

title: Customs officials seize smuggled goods from five passengers at Coimbatore airport
content: According to officials, the Deputy Commissioner of Customs and his team developed intelligence based on data analysis and intercepted five men

title: Parliamentary panel report on new Income Tax Bill, 2025 to be tabled in Lok Sabha on July 21
content: The Committee has made 285 suggestions and at its meeting on July 16 adopted the report on new Income Tax Bill, 2025, which will now be tabled in the House for further action

title: IMD declares orange alert in nine districts in Kerala on July 20
content: The IMD issued orange alert for Ernakulam, Idukki, Thrissur, Palakkad, Malappuram, Kozhikode, Wayanad, Kannur and Kasargode.

title: Kanwariyas assault CRPF jawan in Uttar Pradesh, three arrested
content: The Government Railway Police registered a case against the kanwariyas under sections 115(2) (voluntarily causing hurt), 352 (Intentional insult with intent to provoke breach of peace) of the BNS and the Railway Act

title: How a cook’s brutal murder led to death penalty of a Chennai toddy shop owner in 1940
content: Shanmugasundara Gramani was charged with the murder of Narasammal, a domestic worker employed at his residence. His wife Saradambal and a peon attached to a burial ground at Mylapore were charged with causing the disappearance of evidence of the offence

title: TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee slams Centre over Pahalgam attack; criticises 'foreign policy'
content: Such is the sad state of affairs that people of India had to look to Donald Trump's social media handles and accounts to get updates because they were kept in the dark by this government at the Centre, a PTI source quoted TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee

title: Four militants arrested in Manipur
content: Police arrested an active cadre of the banned outfit UPPK from Kangla Pat in Imphal West district on July 19

title: Body of kidnapped Agra boy found buried in Rajasthan village
content: The recovery was made by the Rajasthan Police on July 19, 2025 following which they informed their Agra counterparts

title: News in Frames: Wular back in the pink
content: The lake in Kashmir has welcomed back lotuses after a gap of 30 years enforced by ecological degradation due to nutrient pollution and silting of the water expanse

title: Over 12,000 new polling stations created in Bihar
content: According to a release issued by the election department on Saturday, July 19, the total number of polling stations has risen to 90,712 from 77,895, after the establishment of 12,817 new ones.

title: WCL cancels India-Pakistan legends match after Harbhajan, Dhawan, Yusuf and others refuse to play
content: The WCL organisers shared a statement on their X account, detailing the decision of cancellation and said their intention while conducting the match was to recreate some “happy memories”

title: Experts call for more awareness on procedures for rescuing mentally ill persons
content: 15 lakh people with mental illness are in the streets, says Indian Psychiatric Society’s former president, and explains legal hurdles involved in rescuing them

title: ‘Needed a robust system to protect legal rights of victims of human trafficking, bonded labour’
content: Role of prosecutors is not only to ensure stringent punishment for the offenders but also to facilitate legal rehabilitation of the victims, says Director of Prosecution Ramakoteswara Rao

title: Steps on to take number of 'Lakhpati Didis' to 2 crore by August 15: Shivraj Singh Chouhan
content: 'Lakhpati Didi' refers to a woman member of a Self-Help Group (SHG) who earns an income of ₹1 lakh or more per year

title: Door-to-door campaign: TDP reaches out to over 50 lakh families in 18 days
content: As part of ‘Suparipalana Lo Tholi Adugu’, the party cadre are creating awareness on welfare schemes and gathering feedback on the government’s performance

title: Man chained, abused; two arrested in Vijayapura district
content: In a shocking incident, a man was illegally detained by chaining him to an iron pole for not turning up for work after taking an advance in Vijayapura district, and the Police have arrested two persons after the incident came to light through social media

title: IIM-Calcutta rape case: Accused student granted bail
content: The accused was arrested on the basis of an FIR lodged by the woman at Haridevpur police station on July 11 and has been in police custody since then

title: Uttarakhand chopper crash: AAIB says helicopter tumbled down hill after rotor blade hit overhead cable
content: In its five-page report, AAIB said the helicopter flew for 20 minutes before descending from its assigned altitude

title: Ahmedabad Air India flight crash: What has AAIB’s preliminary report uncovered?
content: What happened to the engines of AI 171 that went down in Ahmedabad seconds after takeoff? Why is the spotlight on fuel control switches? What has the Aircraft Accident Investigation Bureau cautioned against? Why are pilot bodies upset that the initial report ignores ‘systemic vulnerabilities’ in the aircraft?

title: Team makes powerful water filter with help from light, vibrations
content: Industrial plants release dyes such as Congo Red and Methylene Blue into rivers and groundwater, from where they can cause stomach, skin, and breathing illnesses

title: Nimisha Priya | Hanging fire
content: Family members of the Kerala nurse, who has been sentenced to death for murder in Yemen, see a glimmer of hope after the last-minute postponement of her execution

title: Uttam reviews State-wide water availability, wants optimal use for Kharif
content: Irrg. Dept to launch drive soon to reclaim department properties, land including that of WALAMTARI, ERL in City

title: Overheight DJ vehicles stopped in U.P.'s Meerut, modified to meet Kanwar Yatra safety norms
content: As many as 55 DJ setups were found to have heights ranging from 12 to 16 feet, posing a significant risk to overhead power lines, traffic flow and public safety

title: First phase of Shanthipuram colony redevelopment to get under way soon
content: The project to follow the concept of Pocket Homes, an innovative social housing project designed to optimise space and foster community engagement along a linear axis

title: Female dental student of Greater Noida university found dead in hostel room
content: In a note, the second-year student accuses two of her teachers of ‘mental harassment’; police book five persons in the FIR, detain two for questioning; deceased’s family stages protest, complains of ‘inaction by HOD’ despite alerts; Oppn. raises questions over students’ safety in educational institutions

title: Neither electricity nor bill will come: U.P. Energy Minister on Bihar CM Nitish Kumar’s free electricity announcement
content: Janata Dal (United), a key ally of the BJP hit back at the U.P. Minister asking him to visit U.P.-Bihar border villages to get reality check

title: "Did Not Crush Farmers": Jharkhand Minister On BJP Attack Over Son's Reel
content: Jharkhand Health Minister Irfan Ansari has drawn fire from the Opposition BJP over a video of his 19-year-old son Krish allegedly inspecting a top government hospital in Ranchi. The minister has denied that his son was inspecting the hospital

title: India's UPI Revolution Powers 50% Of World's Digital Payments
content: India is now a global leader in fast payments and theUnified Payments Interface (UPI)is the main driver, as per the InternationalMonetary Fund(IMF).

title: Row Over Jharkhand Minister's Son 'Inspecting' Hospital, 'Making Reel'
content: A political row erupted in Jharkhand on Sunday after a video of Health Minister and Congress leader Irfan Ansari's son's visit to the Rajendra Institute of Medical Sciences (RIMS) in Ranchi for a purported inspection surfaced on social media.

title: Gujarat Couple, 3 Children Found Dead, Relatives Point To EMI Stress
content: A couple and their three children have died in Ahmedabad's Bagodara in a suspected case of mass suicide. The parents allegedly poisoned their two daughters and a son before dying by suicide

title: Rs 2 Crore In Bank, Mini Mansion In Delhi: "Drug Queen's" Empire Falls
content: Delhi Police have seized properties worth approximately Rs 4 crore linked to an alleged drug syndicate led by a woman identified as Kusum, a long-time resident of the Sultanpuri area in North-West Delhi.

title: "First Loyalty?": Shashi Tharoor's Big Remark Amid Rift With Congress
content: Amid his tussle with the Congress leadership over the public remarks in the aftermath of the Pahalgam terror attack, senior party leader and MP Shashi Tharoor has dug his heels in

title: Centre Holds All-Party Meeting Ahead Of Parliament Monsoon Session
content: Leaders of various political parties are attending the meeting where the government is being represented by Parliamentary Affairs Kiren Rijiju and his junior minister Arjun Ram Meghwal.

title: Self-Styled 'Baba' Hits Followers, Feeds Them His Urine In Maharashtra
content: Victims, both men and women, were beaten with sticks, made to shove their own shoes into their mouths, and forced to run in circles around the temple.

title: Pilot Accused Of Raping Air Hostess At His Thane Home, Case Filed
content: A 23-year-old air hostess working with a private airline was allegedly raped by her colleague, a pilot, at his home in Mira Road near Mumbai.

title: 1 Kanwar Pilgrim Dead, 3 Injured After Their Bike Collides With Tractor In UP
content: The incident took place when a group of Kanwariyas attempted to overtake on a narrow stretch of road and crashed into an oncoming tractor.

title: Woman Marries 2 Brothers: Himachal Pradesh's Polyandry Custom Explained
content: Two brothers from the Hatti community in Himachal Pradesh's Sirmaur district married the same woman in a public ceremony in the presence of thousands of locals.

title: "He Is Innocent": Family Defends Man Arrested In Religious Conversion Racket
content: Abu Talib, a resident of Jamia Nagar locality in the Khala Par area of Muzaffarnagar, has been arrested in connection with a large-scale religious conversion racket busted by Uttar Pradesh Police.

title: "Criminals Behind Crimes": Bihar ADG Apologises For Remarks Blaming Farmers
content: Bihar Additional Director General of Police (ADG) Kundan Krishnan has issued a public apology after facing backlash over his recent remarks suggesting a link between increased murders and the farming community.

title: Bihar Hospital Murder Prime Accused Among 4 Arrested In Kolkata
content: Four people have been arrested in Kolkata in connection with the killing of gangster Chandan Mishra inside a private hospital in Patna earlier this month.

title: "DK Shivakumar Not Here, Right?" Siddaramaiah Irked On Party Event Dais
content: The unease within the Karnataka government over the Chief Minister post played out on the stage of an event in Mysuru district yesterday, when Chief Minister Siddaramaiah was irked by a suggestion to name Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar

title: On Camera, Pickup Van, Mini Truck Collide Head On In Maharashtra, 8 Injured
content: A major road accident occurred in Maharashtra's Solapur district when a pickup van and a mini truck collided head-on, leaving eight people injured.

title: Who Was 'The Sleeping Prince', Saudi Royal Who Died After 20-Year Coma
content: Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Khaled bin Talal died on Saturday at the age of 36. Known as "The Sleeping Prince," he died nearly two decades after a car accident in London left him in a coma. He remained on life support under constant care in Riyadh.

title: India On Precipice Of Amazing, Undeniable Global Soft Power: Vir Das
content: India is on the precipice of an "amazing, undeniable" global soft power whose "guardians" in equal measure are both those living in the homeland as well as the Indian diaspora, Emmy-Award winning comedian and actor Vir Das has said.

title: Rohit Pawar's Swipe At NCP As Agriculture Minister Caught Playing Rummy In Assembly
content: Nationalist Congress Party (Sharadchandra Pawar) leader Rohit Pawar on Sunday took a swipe at the Nationalist Congress Party (NCP), saying it is unable to function without consulting its ally, the BJP, in the Maharashtra government.

title: "Speak In Marathi": Fight Over Seat In Mumbai Local Turns Into Language Row
content: The incident took place on Friday evening in a crowded ladies' coach of the train running on the Central line in Mumbai.

title: Chirag Paswan recalls RJD’s rule, blamed Lalu-Rabri for Bihar’s backwardness
content: Without naming anyone, the Union Minister alleged that there are people who want to end his political career. Mr. Paswan claimed that many political parties are afraid of him and they cannot tolerate him

title: L-G office’s push for including Sanskrit in J&K schools not approved yet: J&K govt
content: A government spokesman said the L-G Secretariat had received a representation from Purshotam Lal Dube, who heads a non-governmental organisation, for inclusion of Sanskrit in the schools and colleges of J&K under the provisions of NEP 2020

title: Uttarakhand creating history in development and growth, says Amit Shah
content: Praising CM Pushkar Singh Dhami, the Union Minister said bringing investments to hilly regions is as challenging as climbing a mountain but it was achieved by Mr. Dhami as he broke traditional perceptions

title: Pachapadra oil refinery nearing completion; petrochemical section in last stage
content: The ₹72,937-crore refinery project was caught in a political quagmire after its foundation stone was laid by Sonia Gandhi in 2013, while the BJP government, which came to power subsequently, stalled it to renegotiate the terms with HPCL

title: Badri-Kedar Temple Committee seeking legal advice over construction of replica of Kedarnath temple in Samajwadi Party’s bastion Etawah
content: SP Chief Akhilesh Yadav laid the foundation stone of the Kedareshwar Mahadev Temple in Etawah in 2021, which looks like a replica of the Kadarnath temple

title: Two-week capacity building programme concludes at Central University of Karnataka
content: ‘The development of any nation depends on its capacity for research and innovation. If we are to achieve the goal of ‘Viksit Bharat,’ we must ensure that the benefits of quality research reach the last person in society’

title: Legal provision needed to ensure journalists’ wages, says Sharan Prakash Patil
content: Expressing concerns over job security and low wages of journalists, Minister for Medical Education and Skill Development Sharan Prakash Patil stresses the need for a legal mechanism at the national level to ensure that journalists receive fair and timely wages

title: ADG Kundan Krishnan apologises for linking criminal incidents with farmers
content: In a brief video message posted on Bihar Police official ‘X’ handle Mr. Krishnan said that he had “great respect for those involved in farming” and blamed the controversy on “distorted” representation of his remarks

title: NHAI tests ‘glass grid’ technology to prevent cracks on Chennai-Bengaluru highway
content: The technology was designed by the Indian Institute of Technology-Madras for NHAI; it is expected to prevent cracks on surface

title: CPI has rejected invite to join AIADMK front, says R. Mutharasan
content: He questions if AIADMK general secretary Edappadi K. Palaniswami supports the policies of the BJP-led Centre

title: Stalin has plunged Tamil Nadu into unprecedented debt, says Palaniswami
content: He alleges that the DMK government has borrowed over ₹5 lakh crore since coming to power this term and warns that the burden of repayment would fall on the people

title: IMD issues red alert in Kasaragod, Kannur
content: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red alert for Kasaragod and Kannur districts, while an orange alert has been issued for Kozhikode and Wayanad, anticipating moderate to heavy rainfall on July 20.

title: VMC Commissioner calls for stricter ban on single-use plastic
content: Starting from government offices, schools, colleges, a mandatory plastic ban should be implemented with the cooperation of the people and business organisations, says Dhyanachandra

title: Centre organises national workshop on Jain Manuscriptology at Gujarat University
content: The workshop brought together key scholars and officials to explore and celebrate the profound intellectual and spiritual legacy embedded in Jain manuscripts

title: Andhra Pradesh government will extend all support to industries, says Minister
content: T.G. Bharath visits Atchutapuram SEZ and Nakkapalli cluster; reviews major projects, promises redressal of industry issues and faster clearances

title: Outrage over attempts to kill teen girl by setting her on fire in Odisha
content: Opposition BJD, Congress come down heavily on Mohan Majhi-led BJP government saying Odisha was becoming highly unsafe for women due to government inaction; govt. says such an attack is not acceptable in any civilised society

title: INDIA bloc parties resolve to question foreign policy ‘failures’ of government
content: Leaders of 24 parties hold online meeting to chalk out strategy for the Monsoon Session of Parliament; a discussion on the Pahalgam terror attack, statehood for J&K, the electoral rolls revision in Bihar and delimitation among issues to be raised

title: PSU dividends to Centre almost double since 2020; over 40% comes from five fuel PSUs
content: IOC, BPCL see 255% hike in payouts to Centre, benefiting from 65% crash in crude rates, but only pass on 2% drop in retail petrol prices; faced with slow disinvestment, Centre mandates high dividends from top PSUs

title: Karnataka Tourism Dept. to soon launch waterfall tours
content: The destinations have been identified in Hassan, Chikkamagaluru, Dakshina Kannada, Uttara Kannada, Shivamogga, Kodagu and Belagavi

title: India’s water will now flow only for its people, asserts J&K L-G on Indus Waters Treaty’s abeyance
content: L-G Manoj Sinha made these remarks while releasing author Sant Kumar Sharma’s book Indus Waters Treaty: Mirroring the Facts; he said it was for the first time since Pakistan fought three wars with India in 1965, 1971 and 1999 that the treaty was abandoned

title: Arrest of Indian fishermen lays bare uneasy Delhi-Dhaka ties
content: Policymakers view the arrests as an “absence of understanding” between India and Bangladesh following the fall of the Hasina government. They say that an “unwritten understanding” regarding fishermen is no longer being honoured

title: Stateless for four years, doctor from Pakistan knocks on Gujarat High Court’s door for citizenship
content: Nanikraz Khanoomal Mukhi, 50, moved to India in 2009 for his children’s education and to escape possible religious persecution; after settling down in Ahmedabad, where he has relatives, Dr. Mukhi applied for citizenship in 2016 but it has been elusive

title: SIT arrests YSRCP’s Rajampet MP Midhun Reddy in Andhra Pradesh liquor scam
content: Named Accused No. 4 in the case, Midhun Reddy is charged with playing a key role in the multi-crore scam, conspiring with the other accused to divert the money collected from the distillery companies; he will be produced in the ACB Special Court in Vijayawada on July 20

title: Uproar over patient in oxygen mask sitting on the floor in U.P. Azamgarh hospital
content: A video shows a patient on the floor allegedly due to lack of beds in an Azamgarh hospital; Congress leader Anil Yadav raises concerns about healthcare in Uttar Pradesh

title: Defending land, not pushing divisive agenda: Assam CM counters Mamata
content: Unchecked infiltration of Muslims from across the border has already caused a demographic shift, Himanta Biswa Sarma says

title: Under attack from Opposition, BJP govt. in Odisha launches ‘Shaktishree’ for safety of girls in colleges
content: After the self-immolation death of a girl over alleged sexual harassment, the State government proposes to establish ‘Shaktishree Empowerment Cell’ in all universities and colleges in the State. Chief Minister Mohan Majhi says the initiative is in response to the rise in crimes against girl students

title: Karnataka govt. notifies draft on setting up five corporations in Bengaluru
content: The draft splits the civic limits into five corporations - Central, North, East, West, and South corporations, of varying sizes in terms of area, population, population density, and even projected property tax potential of these corporations

title: Over 500 personnel to be deployed in Aluva for ‘Karkidaka Vavu Bali’
content: The Fort Kochi Sub-Collector and the Muvattupuzha Revenue Divisional Officer have been assigned to oversee the arrangements

title: Restoration work at Srinagar’s Vachar Nag Temple begins
content: J&K Chief Secretary and Srinagar DC initiate restoration of historic Vachar Nag Temple, which was abandoned in the 1990s when Kashmiri Pandits left the Valley in the wake of rising militancy

title: NIRF to award mild penalty to institutions for retractions this year, harsh penalty next year
content: By awarding a negative score for retractions, we want to send out a strong message that research should be conducted ethically, says Anil Sahashrabudhe, Chairperson of the National Board of Accreditation

title: Blame game between HYDRAA, residents as inundation continues
content: Members of an illustrious family after whose name the Patny Colony was named, got into a bitter argument with HYDRAA chief A.V. Ranganath accusing the agency’s action more than a month ago as the reason for the flooding of the colony and surrounding areas.

title: Holloway ends trilogy with win in Poirier's farewell
content: Dustin Poirier's final fight ended in a unanimous decision loss to Max Holloway in a thrilling UFC 318 main event Saturday night.

title: WNBA stars wear 'Pay Us What You Owe Us' shirts
content: WNBA All-Stars took the court for warmups Saturday wearing T-shirts that read "Pay Us What You Owe Us," a reference to the players' biggest gripe during the ongoing CBA negotiations.

title: Collier keys All-Star win with record 36 points
content: Napheesa Collier scored a record 36 points to help her team beat Team Clark 151-131 in the WNBA All-Star Game on Saturday.

title: Pacquiao falls short of history in draw with Barrios
content: Manny Pacquiao showed he's still got something left at age 46 but walked out of the ring without a title Saturday night, when he fought champion Mario Barrios to a majority draw.

title: Sources: Smart agrees to buyout; to join Lakers
content: Marcus Smart has agreed to a contract buyout with the Wizards and plans to sign a two-year, $11 million deal with the Lakers after clearing waivers, sources told ESPN.

title: Scheffler up 4, closes in on first title at The Open
content: Scottie Scheffler moved within one round of claiming the third leg of the Grand Slam on Saturday when he made an eagle and two big par saves for a 4-under 67 in The Open that gave him a four-shot lead at Royal Portrush.

title: Usyk KO's Dubois to become undisputed champion
content: Oleksandr Usyk ruthlessly knocked out Daniel Dubois in Round 5 to become undisputed world heavyweight champion once again on Saturday.

title: Still unsigned, Bengals DE Stewart doesn't report
content: Bengals defensive end Shemar Stewart is the lone first-round pick in this year's draft class who has not signed his rookie deal.

title: 💎 Eagles' Super Bowl ring has pop-out wings
content: The Eagles' Super Bowl LIX rings feature a hidden button that, when pressed, extends the wings on either side, revealing coach Nick Sirianni's saying, "You can't be great without the greatness of others."

title: UFC 318: Poirier retires, Holloway impresses and the prelims are ... must-see?
content: Max Holloway and Dustin Poirier set the bar high for finale fights, even after the undercard showed out.

title: Pacquiao wants to fight again. Can Romero or Mayweather be next?
content: Manny Pacquiao wants to fight again, and he has a few ideas for his next fight before the end of the year.

title: Germany offered France the Euro 2025 semifinal on a silver platter, but France lost anyway
content: Germany advance in Euro 2025 and France crash out again after a wild game with a red card, multiple big VAR calls, extra time and PK shootout.

title: NBA summer league standouts: Flagg, Harper, Hansen and surprise stars
content: From Cooper Flagg to veteran players, Kevin Pelton hands out superlatives for 2025 NBA summer league.

title: Five overreactions before 2025 NFL season: Commanders win NFC East? Chiefs lose AFC West?
content: Is the Bucs QB destined for a massive new contract? Will the Commanders own the NFC East? We're judging offseason overreactions.

content: As the Big Ten looks to produce its third straight national champion, Bill Connelly breaks down all 18 teams.

title: Timeline: Caitlin Clark's injury-riddled first half of the WNBA season
content: Three separate injuries have sidelined the Indiana point guard and All-Star for 10 regular-season WNBA games.

title: 'We couldn't chance it': Why the Suns and Bradley Beal finally came to terms
content: One element of the Suns' roster failure has loomed: How to end their marriage to the three-time All-Star.

title: Messi scores 2, sets up 2 as Miami routs Red Bulls
content: Lionel Messi had two goals and two assists to lead Inter Miami CF to a bounce-back 5-1 win over the host New York Red Bulls on Saturday night in Harrison, New Jersey.

title: Source: USMNT's Sargent close to Wolfsburg move
content: USMNT forward Josh Sargent is on the verge of joining Bundesliga side Wolfsburg for a deal worth in excess of €21 million, a source has told ESPN.

title: Sources: Rashford close to Barcelona loan move
content: Marcus Rashford is on the verge of a seasonlong loan move to Barcelona after Man United gave permission for him to open talks, sources told ESPN.

title: USWNT's Rodman returns to training with Spirit
content: United States forward Trinity Rodman returned to training with the Washington Spirit on Saturday for the first time in three months.

title: Germany GK stars in shootout win over France
content: Ann-Katrin Beger pulled off a stunning final save as Germany beat France 6-5 in a penalty shootout to set up a Euro 2025 semifinal showdown with world champions Spain after a bruising encounter that ended 1-1 after extra time.

title: Amorim admits United lack pace after Leeds draw
content: Ruben Amorim admitted Manchester United lacked pace and need to improve in the final third, as they began their preseason campaign with a goalless draw against Leeds.

title: Isak missed game due to speculation - Howe
content: Newcastle United manager Eddie Howe said Alexander Isak missed the 4-0 preseason defeat against Celtic due to speculation linking him with a transfer.

title: No Madueke, Gyökeres for Arsenal preseason tour
content: Arsenal have departed for their pre-season tour to Asia without Viktor Gyökeres as talks continue with Sporting Lisbon over a move for the striker.

title: ⚽ England win weirdest-ever penalty shootout
content: England came back from a 2-0 deficit to take Sweden to penalties and seal their place in the Euro 2025 semifinals, but they did it by virtue of one of the strangest, and longest, penalty shootouts ever.

title: Chiefs QB Patrick Mahomes ready to enter new era: Turning 30
content: Mahomes has won two MVPs and three Super Bowls in his 20s. He'll turn 30 as he starts his ninth NFL season.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Newcastle in for Randal Kolo Muani

content: Moving the draft to All-Star week was supposed to give it some sizzle. But not one player was in attendance.

title: From Skylar Diggins to Eric Gordon: Ranking Indiana's top high school hoopers since 2000
content: As part of SportsCenter's "50 States in 50 Days" tour, we're spotlighting the top boys and girls hoopers to come out of Indiana based on high school career achievements.

title: ‘Give shock if pills don't work’: Wife, lover plotted Delhi jeweller’s murder
content: In a shocking incident in Delhi's Dwarka, police arrested a woman and her lover for allegedly murdering her husband. Sushmita, aided by her relative Rahul, reportedly drugged Karan Dev with sleeping pills before electrocuting him. Instagram chats revealed their meticulous planning, including discussions on dosage and methods.

title: PM Modi to visit UK, Maldives from July 23 to 26: Malé outreach, bilateral relations among agenda
content: Prime Minister Modi is set to visit the UK and the Maldives from July 23-26, strengthening international ties. In the UK, he'll meet PM Starmer and King Charles III, aiming to sign a Free Trade Agreement. Subsequently, he will visit the Maldives as a guest of honor at their Independence Day celebrations.

title: Patna hospital shooting: Main accused Taushif alias Badshah detained from Kolkata
content: Bihar Police, in collaboration with Kolkata Police and STF, have apprehended Taushif alias Badshah, the primary suspect in the Paras hospital murder case where Chandan Mishra was fatally shot by gunmen. Nishu Khan and two others were also detained, revealing the murder conspiracy was hatched at Khan's residence.

title: Menace in the sky: UP villagers chase drones with sticks & stones
content: A drone flying over a jail in Uttar Pradesh has sparked widespread fear and suspicion. Residents across multiple districts are reporting strange lights and drones, leading to rooftop vigils and heightened anxiety. While police investigate potential links to thefts and monitor drone activity, villagers remain vigilant, fearing they are under surveillance.

title: IND vs ENG: 'In the batters' face' - Ex-cricketer hails fired-up Indian bowlers
content: Despite trailing 1-2, Murali Kartik is impressed by India's fiery bowling unit in the England series. He highlights their intensity and unity, especially at Lord's, where their passion was palpable. Kartik also praises their ability to induce false shots from English batters in their home conditions, led by Siraj, Bumrah, and Akash Deep.

title: Quit Instagram: Perplexity CEO warns about job market reality; suggests do this instead
content: Perplexity CEO Aravind Srinivas advises young individuals to prioritize mastering AI tools over excessive social media use, emphasizing that AI proficiency will significantly enhance employability. He acknowledges the challenges of adapting to rapidly evolving AI technology, which changes every three to six months.

title: ‘Go home, make chapatis’: Personal insults at Sharda University’s dental dept common
content: Sharda University's dental science department faces scrutiny after a student's suicide, with batchmates alleging a toxic environment fostered by faculty. Students describe demeaning comments, public humiliation, and a fear of reprisal for mistakes. The university claims to have a mental health support system, but students express feeling isolated and unheard, highlighting the need for a thorough investigation.

title: Odisha horror: 15-year-old girl set on fire by miscreants airlifted to AIIMS Delhi
content: A 15-year-old girl, who suffered 70-75% burn injuries after being set on fire in Puri district, was airlifted from Bhubaneswar to AIIMS Delhi for specialized treatment. Her condition is critical, requiring cardiovascular care and constant monitoring. The incident has sparked outrage, leading to protests and demands for justice, occurring a week after a similar self-immolation case in Balasore.

title: Holiday turns nightmare: Girl drowns in resort pool, owners told to pay Rs 10L
content: A Bengaluru couple was awarded ₹10 lakh in compensation after their 12-year-old daughter drowned in an unsupervised pool at Dwarasamudra Resort in Hassan. The consumer commission held the resort owners liable for negligence, citing the absence of a lifeguard, safety signage, and medical facilities.

title: MacBook Air M4 deal: Get it at Rs 59,990 on Flipkart; combine bank & exchange deal offers
content: Apple launched the MacBook Air M4 in March 2025, featuring the powerful M4 chipset for enhanced performance and efficiency. Meanwhile, the MacBook Air M3 is now available on Flipkart at a discounted price. The 13.6-inch Midnight model, with 16GB RAM and 256GB storage, sees a price reduction from Rs 99,900. Further discounts include exchange offers up to Rs 25,000 and an instant Rs 10,000 off with ICICI Bank credit cards.

title: Stage set for a stormy Monsoon Session; Centre, oppn to face-off: Here's what to expect
content: The Monsoon Session of Parliament is set to begin with a contentious atmosphere as the opposition INDIA bloc and the BJP-led government clash on issues like the Pahalgam attack, Operation Sindoor, and foreign policy. Several bills are slated for consideration, including those related to sports governance, geoheritage sites, and mining regulations.

title: CRPF jawan assaulted by kanwariyas at Mirzapur railway station over train ticket
content: In Mirzapur, three kanwariyas were arrested on Sunday following a clash with a CRPF jawan at the railway station. The altercation arose over train tickets as both parties attempted to board the Brahmaputra Express; the jawan was heading to Manipur for duty, while the kanwariyas aimed for Baidyanath Dham. GRP intervened, eventually assisting the jawan onto the train.

title: Gujarat shocker: Family of 5 members die by suicide in Ahmedabad
content: In a tragic incident in Gujarat's Ahmedabad district, a couple and their three young children were found dead in their home in Bagodara village early Sunday morning. Police suspect the family consumed poison in what appears to be a mass suicide. Authorities are investigating the circumstances surrounding this devastating event, with the man identified as an auto-rickshaw driver.

title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang: Whenever I get an answer from AI, I always ask …
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang leverages multiple AI chatbots, comparing their responses to gain comprehensive insights, similar to seeking multiple medical opinions. He tailors AI explanations to his understanding level, even requesting explanations as if he were a 12-year-old. Huang believes that interacting with AI enhances cognitive skills by requiring analytical thinking and reasoned questioning.

title: 'Smart president, won't let dollar fall': Trump hits out at BRICS over threat to US currency dominance
content: Donald Trump has criticized the BRICS economic alliance, accusing it of attempting to undermine the dominance of the U.S. dollar. He threatened to impose a 10% tariff on member nations—Brazil, Russia, India, China, and South Africa—if they pursue alternatives to the dollar. Trump emphasized the importance of protecting the dollar as the world's reserve currency.

title: WCL : Sponsors ditch Pakistan after India legends’ shock exit — ‘Will not engage in...’
content: The veterans' cricket match between India and Pakistan in the World Championship of Legends has been cancelled after Indian players withdrew, citing the Pahalgam terror attack and facing social media criticism. EaseMyTrip, a major sponsor, reiterated its stance against supporting matches involving Pakistan. Organizers apologized for hurting sentiments and cancelled the match, despite initially aiming to create positive moments.

title: Three earthquakes off Russia's coast: Tsunami alert issued after 7.4 magnitude quake
content: A series of powerful earthquakes rattled Russia's Far East coast on Sunday, prompting a tsunami alert. The United States Geological Survey reported the strongest quake at a magnitude of 7.4, striking near Petropavlovsk-Kamchatsky. This triggered a warning of potential hazardous tsunami waves within a 300-kilometer radius.

title: 'Friend reached Dubai and am still stuck here': Bengaluru traffic post goes viral
content: A Bengaluru resident humorously highlighted the city's infamous traffic congestion in an Instagram post. The post claims a traveler reached Dubai while the poster was still stuck in Bengaluru traffic. This relatable scenario sparked a massive online discussion, with many users sharing similar experiences of traffic delays rivaling international flight times.

title: 'Need to cooperate ...': Shashi Tharoor answers question on 'loyalty' amid Congress rift buzz
content: Shashi Tharoor, a Congress MP, emphasized that national interests should take precedence over party loyalty, referencing Nehru's words. This statement comes amid internal criticism within the Congress party, particularly after Tharoor's support for the government on national security matters and praise for PM Modi's diplomatic efforts.

title: Shaquille O’Neal predicts how long new couple Thompson and Stallion will last
content: Klay Thompson and Megan Thee Stallion's budding romance has captured attention, marked by public appearances and shared workouts. Despite their apparent happiness, Shaquille O'Neal predicts a short-lived relationship, estimating it will last only six weeks. However, Mike Tyson countered, suggesting the couple might have more staying power, considering their connection and compatibility.

title: ‘Don’ director Chandra Barot dies at 86 in Mumbai
content: Chandra Barot, the veteran filmmaker known for directing the Amitabh Bachchan starrer 'Don', has died. He was 86. Barot had been battling pulmonary fibrosis for seven years. He directed 'Don' to support his friend Nariman Irani. Before directing, Barot worked as an assistant director with Manoj Kumar. His contribution to Indian cinema will be remembered.

title: IND vs ENG: Pant on verge of history as big record beckons ahead of 4th Test
content: Team India vice-captain Rishabh Pant, recovering from a finger injury, has signaled his intention to play in the crucial fourth Test against England, showcasing his fitness through a vigorous training video. He is close to surpassing Virender Sehwag's record of 90 Test sixes, needing just three more to claim the top spot.

title: 8 Indian-origin men held in US for kidnapping, torture, extortion
content: Authorities in California and the FBI investigated eight Indian-origin suspects. The suspects were arrested in connection with a kidnapping and torture case. The case involved an international Punjabi street gang. The gang is accused of running a brutal extortion racket. The racket stretches from California to murder plots in India.

title: IND vs ENG: Akash doubtful for Manchester, Bumrah set to play
content: India’s pace department faces fresh concerns ahead of the fourth Test in Manchester, with Akash Deep nursing a back niggle and Arshdeep Singh already injured. Jasprit Bumrah is set to play in the fourth Test in Manchester, starting from July 23.

title: Kapil Sharma's Kap's Cafe in Canada reopens days after shooting incident
content: Comedian Kapil Sharma's Kap's Cafe in Surrey, Canada, is set to reopen after a week-long closure following a shooting incident. Multiple gunshots were fired outside the cafe on July 10, causing damage but no injuries. Kapil Sharma shared the reopening announcement on Instagram, expressing pride in his team and gratitude for the support received.

title: D-Street ahead: What will guide market sentiment this week?
content: The upcoming week is poised to be eventful for the stock market, influenced by a multitude of factors. Investors will closely monitor Q1 corporate earnings from major companies, US market trends, and various corporate actions like dividends and bonus issues.

title: 'Why 'Hamas-run hospital' but never ‘US-backed IDF’?': Zohran Mamdani
content: Democratic mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani has accused the BBC of biased reporting on the Israel-Gaza conflict, criticizing their selective language. He questioned why the broadcaster uses labels for groups like the Houthis and Hamas, but avoids similar descriptions for the IDF or Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. Mamdani's stance has drawn both support and criticism, including attacks from Donald Trump.

title: Boxing | Nishant Dev clinches TKO win over LaQuan Evans in Frisco - watch
content: Nishant Dev, the Indian boxing sensation, secured his third consecutive professional victory with a TKO win against LaQuan Evans in Frisco, USA. The 24-year-old dominated the Super Welterweight bout, culminating in a sixth-round stoppage. This win further solidifies Dev's position as a rising star in the global boxing arena, showcasing his potential after turning professional.

title: Akbar misrepresented in textbooks? JNU scholar takes on NCERT over jizya claim
content: In a television debate, JNU historian Dr Ruchika Sharma criticised NCERT’s revised history textbooks for allegedly misrepresenting Mughal emperor Akbar’s abolition of the jizya tax. She stated that Akbar removed the tax in 1562, prior to consolidating his empire, and challenged claims that jizya was used to coerce religious conversions. Sharma announced plans to file an RTI seeking sources used in the textbooks, and her remarks also drew political response over comments on Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj.

title: IND vs ENG: Pant drops an update on his injury - 'If calm had a sound...'
content: Rishabh Pant has hinted at his recovery from a finger injury sustained during the third Test against England. He shared a video showcasing his participation in batting, fielding, and football drills, suggesting improved fitness.

title: CRPF jawan kills ASI partner over argument, surrenders after failed suicide attempt
content: In Anjar, Gujarat, a 25-year-old woman police officer, Aruna Jadav, was murdered by her live-in partner, Dilip Jadav, a CRPF jawan. Following an argument, Dilip strangled Aruna at their rented home. He then attempted suicide but survived. On Saturday morning, Dilip surrendered to Anjar police and confessed to the crime. Police are investigating the events leading to Aruna's death.

title: Why are mentally ill soldiers being drafted in Ukraine?
content: Despite a history of psychiatric care for a personality disorder, Vasyl was drafted into the Ukrainian military, raising concerns about the screening process. His condition, exacerbated by stress, poses risks to himself and others, yet his diagnosis wasn't accessible to military doctors due to data privacy restrictions.

title: Watch: Flash floods submerge vehicles as heavy rain lashes Washington DC
content: Torrential rainfall led to flash flooding across Washington DC, Maryland, and Virginia on Saturday, triggering numerous emergency rescues. Some suburbs recorded over 5 inches of rain, rendering major roads impassable. Rescue crews responded to calls, saving dozens, including those trapped in vehicles, with no reported injuries. Flood warnings remained in effect for several areas.

title: 'His phone kept ringing': AIIMS-Patna student dies by suicide in hostel
content: Jadavendra Sahu, a 25-year-old first-year MD student from Odisha at AIIMS-Patna, was found dead in his hostel room, with police suspecting suicide by anesthetic drug overdose. After he didn't respond, his room was opened, and he was rushed to the emergency ward, where he was pronounced dead.

title: 'Alia Bhatt as Sita, Suriya as Lord Rama': Vishnu Manchu has a script ready
content: Director Nitesh Tiwari has taken the internet by storm with the first glimpse of his upcoming movie ‘Ramayana’, starring Ranbir Kapoor, Yash and Sai Pallavi in the lead roles. Actor Vishnu Manchu has now revealed that he has been planning a mythological project based on the Ramayana for a very long time — but from the perspective of Ravana.

title: Ravi Kishan reveals he felt his film career ended after joining politics
content: Ravi Kishan revealed on The Great Indian Kapil Show his fears of his acting career ending after becoming a Member of Parliament. He recounted his role in 'Laapata Ladies' and its journey to the Oscars, expressing gratitude for unexpected opportunities.

title: India vs Pakistan match called off: Legends withdraw; WCL issues apology
content: The World Championship of Legends (WCL) has cancelled the India vs Pakistan match after facing strong opposition from Indian cricket legends and sponsors. Shikhar Dhawan publicly refused to participate, citing geopolitical tensions and national pride. Other Indian players and sponsor EaseMyTrip also voiced their concerns, leading to the fixture's cancellation and a public apology from WCL organisers.

title: UFC 318 main match card highlights: Max Holloway vs. Dustin Poirier, and more
content: UFC 318 from the Smoothie King Center in New Orleans, Louisiana, witnessed Dustin Poirier's emotional MMA farewell after an epic battle with Max Holloway, where Holloway showcased striking prowess, but Poirier's resilience shone through. Paulo Costa secured a unanimous decision against Roman Kopylov, later calling out Khamzat Chimaev. The rest of the main card delivered big time.

title: 'I feel out of place': Anderson on sharing name with Tendulkar on the trophy
content: England's veteran bowler, James Anderson, expressed humility about sharing a trophy name with Indian cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar. The new Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, unveiled before the India-England Test series, will represent all future Test series between the two nations. Anderson admitted feeling "out of place" alongside Tendulkar, whom he holds in high regard, despite his own remarkable achievements.

title: School bus driver asks 7-year-old to shut door; boy falls and dies
content: In a tragic incident in Magadi, a seven-year-old boy died after falling from a moving school bus due to the driver's negligence. The driver, R Vinod, asked the child to close an improperly locked door while the bus was in motion, leading to the fatal accident. Vinod has been arrested for culpable homicide and placed in judicial custody.

title: Shah Rukh Khan didn't get injured on sets of ‘King’ - Here’s what really happened
content: Recent rumors of Shah Rukh Khan's injury on the set of 'King' and subsequent relocation plans are false, according to NDTV. While SRK has had past injuries and travels to the US for treatment, his recent trip in July is routine. This isn't the first time such rumors have surfaced.

title: Who is Faith Ward? Everything you need to know about Kiwi Dallas Cowboys Cheerleader
content: Faith Ward, a 22-year-old dancer from Western Australia, has made history as the first New Zealander to join the Dallas Cowboys Cheerleaders. Her journey from cruise ships to the NFL spotlight showcases her resilience and dedication. Ward's emotional reaction to securing her spot resonated globally, making her a symbol of aspiration for dancers across Australasia.

title: Freestyle Chess Grand Slam: Praggnanandhaa beats Magnus Carlsen
content: Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa, the Indian chess prodigy, has once again defeated World No. 1 Magnus Carlsen at the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam in Las Vegas. The 19-year-old grandmaster secured his second victory over Carlsen in the tournament, showcasing his tactical prowess. Despite Carlsen winning the semifinal clash, Praggnanandhaa's impressive performance solidifies his position as a rising star in the chess world.

title: Op Sindoor: India’s missile hit Pakistan’s N-hub Kirana Hills; satellite images suggest
content: Satellite imagery from June 2025 appears to confirm an Indian missile strike on Pakistan's Kirana Hills in May, a site linked to Pakistan's nuclear program. While India initially denied targeting the area during Operation Sindoor, the images reveal an impact location. The images also show repaired runways at Sargodha airbase, suggesting damage from Indian strikes and the base's strategic importance.

title: IND vs ENG: 'He's a legend, but ...' - Raina on Bumrah's availability for 4th Test
content: As India and England gear up for the crucial fourth Test, the spotlight is on Jasprit Bumrah's potential inclusion in the XI. Suresh Raina emphasised that the decision regarding Bumrah's participation rests with the medical team, considering his workload and recent injury.

title: Why Drake Maye can be a top-10 QB in 2025
content: in 11 starts from Week 6 to Week 17, Drake Maye threw for 2,254 yards, 15 touchdowns and 10 interceptions . that translated to an average of 16.0 fantasy points per game in those starts, which would have ranked just outside the top 12 quarterbacks over a full season . Maye has all the makings of a top-10 fantasy quarterback .

title: If the College Football Playoff isn't broken, why fix it?
content: college football's opposition to an expanded, let alone expansive, playoff is dead and buried . the 81-year-old retired just this week after a second stint leading west Virginia University . plans to move from 12 participants to 16 were underway before last season's inaugural 12-teamer even took place .

title: How to approach potential Rashee Rice suspension
content: fantasy football buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the NFL . fantasy managers should brace for the likelihood Rice will miss a noticeable portion of the 2025 season . the odds of him serving a multigame suspension have significantly increased .

title: How good is Usyk after his Round 5 KO of Dubois, and what next?
content: Oleksandr Usyk beats Daniel Dubois in round 5 at wembley stadium . the undisputed heavyweight king will go down in history as the best heavyweight for the past two decades . usyk can also be considered the best cruiserweight foe since lennox Lewis .

title: WNBA All-Star grades: MVP Collier scores A+ in leading team to victory
content: team collier beats team Clark 151-131 at Gainbridge Fieldhouse . team captain caitlin Clark was sidelined by injury . the city of Indianapolis embraced hosting the game, and fans showed out in full force .

title: Our latest intel on MLB trade deadline rumors, Tucker's free agency and more
content: the baseball world gathered in Atlanta for the 2025 MLB draft , home run Derby and all-star game this week . our reporters were there talking to execs, coaches, agents, scouts, players and other team sources .

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Sancho, Rashford headed to Juve?
content: the transfer window is open across Europe, and business is starting to get done . sportsmail's reporters hear about possible deals every Friday until September . it's highly unlikely that Juventus will get both players, for a number of reasons .

content: the TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide . the team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics .

title: Sights and sounds from the Open Championship's third round
content: the third round of the 153rd Open Championship is underway at royal portrush golf course in northern Ireland . Scottie Scheffler came into the weekend leading the pack with a 10-under mark . he reflects on maintaining his lead at the open championship .

title: Rory McIlroy made crowds roar Saturday, but he's still chasing an inevitable Scottie Scheffler
content: PORTRUSH, northern Ireland -- one of the highest points at royal portrush . eagle putt tipped into bottom of the tee box on the 12th hole . the noise reached a climax as he tapped in for another birdie .
